text: Hi guys, I have an app for integrating the HubSpot and Zoho with webhook. I have already integrated some modules. But, I want to integrate campaign modules. Like when a campaign is created ı want to receive webhook. But, when ı check for webhook subscription, ı couldn't see campaign modules. Is there any way to receive webhook for campaign

Is there a way to delete HS LOG when using HubSpot API ? because testing my function I have an error
`A server error occurred: WARNING: The logs for this function have exceeded the 4KB limit.`

Not sure - but function logs come from an API endpoint (which isn’t documented): <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/blob/1f86a368c3a2d537cd4fee67827b472f89ba656a/packages/cms-lib/api/results.js>

Maybe it supports a delete method/put method? (i take no responsibility here :smile:)

Hi everyone. (HubSpot noob here) I got asked if it was possible to import calls and emails into HubSpot vis APIs. It seems to me it's not possible to hook into the 'native' calls/emails, but can perhaps be achieved by creating two new types of timeline events. Is that correct? It seems I cannot use timeline events that are not created by my app, is that correct?
You can track those easily via the engagement endpoints: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/create_engagement>
That's amazing. Completely missed those. Perhaps due to it being hosted on legacy docs. Thanks a lot!

The new API is still under development (Engagements: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/engagements>) and far from feature-complete. For reference reasons (e.g. check if something is possible) you will have to consider the v2 (legacy) API.

<@ULSCN5SSW> Thanks for the reply! You're right, we'd probably need to increase the syncing frequency down the road. We see there's two ways of keeping data up to date, either with the legacy get_recently_updated endpoint or the POST search object endpoint (filter by lastmodifieddate), which way did you use? Another question we have is how would you sync the relationships efficiently. We see there's a separate endpoint in syncing the relationship but is there anyways to tell if the related object is updated through the primary object?

Hi Loic, I’ve updated our logs documentation to add a note about this, hope it helps.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli#logs>
